name: Thomas ELLISOR, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE INSURANCE COMPANY and Firemen's Insurance Company, Appellees

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: Thomas ELLISOR, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE INSURANCE COMPANY and Firemen’s Insurance Company, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN, J., dissents.
ZAPPALA, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Jerome W. Kiger and Jeffrey Reed, Grogan, Graffam, McGinley, Solomon & Lucchino, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
James R. Hartline, Thomson, Rhodes & Grigsby, Pittsburgh, for Firemen’s Ins. Co.
casebody.head_matter:
487 A.2d 1319
Thomas ELLISOR, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE INSURANCE COMPANY and Firemen’s Insurance Company, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 12, 1984.
Decided Feb. 20, 1985.
Jerome W. Kiger and Jeffrey Reed, Grogan, Graffam, McGinley, Solomon & Lucchino, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
James R. Hartline, Thomson, Rhodes & Grigsby, Pittsburgh, for Firemen’s Ins. Co.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
